overview: Dr. Crowder’s independent program of research focuses on utilizing interdisciplinary, mixed-methods designs to investigate the complex relationships among dietary patterns, eating behaviors, nutritional status, and patient-centered survivorship outcomes such as quality of life and symptom burden in cancer survivors. Her goal is to develop new and beneficial dietary recommendations and medical nutrition therapies for cancer patients and survivors.
research_interests:
Dr. Crowder’s independent program of research focuses on utilizing interdisciplinary, mixed-methods designs to investigate the complex relationships among dietary patterns, eating behaviors, nutritional status, and patient-centered survivorship outcomes such as quality of life and symptom burden in cancer survivors. Her goal is to develop new and beneficial dietary recommendations and medical nutrition therapies for cancer patients and survivors.
